title: Bungling young driver crashes a stolen car into a luxury Lamborghini
text:
A teenager has left a $200,000 trail of destruction after he allegedly stole a car and crashed it into a luxury Lamborghini.

The 14-year-old boy was arrested with a number of offences after attempting to get away from police in Como, in Perth's south.

Police were in the area shortly after 8pm, conducting patrols after a Subaru Forester was reported stolen during a burglary on October 6.

Officers saw the car in a driveway on Birdwood Avenue and parked behind it, attempting to close it in and stop the driver from leaving.

However, as police exited the car, it is alleged the Forester quickly reversed and crashed into the rear of the police car.

The boy then drove west down Birdwood Avenue where it crashed into a luxury yellow Lamborghini at the intersection on the end of the street.

The Lamborghini appears to be a Urus, which reportedly cost more than $350,000.

The 14-year-old fled the scene on foot but police caught up with him and arrested him.

He was then charged with two counts of stealing a moto vehicle, three counts of stealing, one count of aggravated burglary and one count of aggravated burglary with intent.

The teenager was due to appear in Perth Children's court on Wednesday.

Western Australia Police said the investigation is continuing and asks anyone with information to contact Crime Stoppers.
description: The 14-year-old boy was arrested with a number of offences after attempting to get away from police in Como, in Perth's south and allegedly crashed a stolen car into a luxury Lamborghini.
authors: Lauren Ferri For Daily Mail Australia
